io.spine.server

Class BoundedContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.integration.grpc.IntegrationEventSubscriberGrpc.IntegrationEventSubscriberImplBase
      • io.spine.server.BoundedContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.grpc.BindableService, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public final class BoundedContext
extends io.spine.server.integration.grpc.IntegrationEventSubscriberGrpc.IntegrationEventSubscriberImplBase
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A facade for configuration and entry point for handling commands.

    • Method Detail

      • newName

        public static io.spine.core.BoundedContextName newName(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new value object for a bounded context name.

        The name argument value must not be null or empty.

        This method, however, does not check for the uniqueness of the value passed.

        Parameters:
        name - the unique string name of the BoundedContext
        Returns:
        a newly created name

      • newBuilder

        public static BoundedContext.Builder newBuilder()
        Creates a new builder for BoundedContext.
        Returns:
        new builder instance

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Closes the BoundedContext performing all necessary clean-ups.

        This method performs the following:

        1. Closes associated StorageFactory.
        2. Closes CommandBus.
        3. Closes EventBus.
        4. Closes IntegrationBus.
        5. Closes CommandStore.
        6. Closes EventStore.
        7. Closes Stand.
        8. Shuts down all registered repositories. Each registered repository is:
          • un-registered from CommandBus
          • un-registered from EventBus
          • detached from its storage
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - caused by closing one of the components

      • getName

        public io.spine.core.BoundedContextName getName()
        Obtains an ID of the bounded context.

        The ID allows to identify a bounded context if a multi-context application. If the ID was not defined, during the building process, the context would get BoundedContext.DEFAULT_NAME.

        Returns:
        the ID of this BoundedContext

      • getStorageFactory

        public StorageFactory getStorageFactory()
        Obtains StorageFactory associated with this BoundedContext.

      • isMultitenant

        @CheckReturnValue
public boolean isMultitenant()
        Returns:
        true if the bounded context serves many organizations

      • register

        public <I,E extends Entity<I,?>> void register(Repository<I,E> repository)
        Registers the passed repository with the BoundedContext.

        If the repository does not have a storage assigned, it will be initialized using the StorageFactory associated with this bounded context.

        Checks whether there is a default state for entity type.

        Type Parameters:
        I - the type of IDs used in the repository
        E - the type of entities or aggregates
        Parameters:
        repository - the repository to register
        See Also:
        Repository.initStorage(StorageFactory)
